items.sentence: I just wish I could have some alone time with Tom.
She advised him to talk about his life in America.
She always lets her children do what they want to.
She asked him to call her later, but he forgot to.
She asked him to help her father clean the garage.
Let\'s talk quietly so we don\'t wake up the baby.
Tom doesn\'t believe Mary can get home by herself.
Tom doesn\'t care what other people say about him.
Tom doesn\'t even know what you are talking about.
Tom doesn\'t have a credit card or a bank account.
Tom doesn\'t have a suitcase, so he borrowed mine.
Tom doesn\'t have as much free time as he used to.
I\'ve made up my mind to study harder from now on.
I\'ve never heard him complaining about his meals.
I\'ve paid parking fines a number of times myself.
I\'ve warned you over and over again not to do it.
If he doesn\'t accept the job, somebody else will.
Tom said he didn\'t plan to go to Mary\'s concert.
Tom seems to be preparing for tomorrow\'s lessons.
A boy of seventeen is often as tall as his father.
A piano is expensive, but a car is more expensive.
Both of us began to smile almost at the same time.
Can you please tell me what time the train leaves?
Do you really think Tom will be able to help Mary?
There\'s no need to hurry. We have plenty of time.
Tom and Mary don\'t really speak French very well.
A policeman asked the girls if the car was theirs.
All of my kids went to Boston to visit my parents.
Boston is one of the places I visited last summer.
I spent the whole weekend at home on the computer.
I think that you should buy yourself a new ladder.
I want to know when my baggage is going to arrive.
I was caught in a shower on my way to the station.
Tom doesn\'t have a ticket for tonight\'s concert.
If it\'s raining tomorrow, we\'ll go there by car.
Tom and Mary need to take a break from each other.
Tom and Mary walked down the street holding hands.
Tom found out that somebody had stolen his wallet.
Tom wasn\'t surprised that Mary didn\'t like John.
Tom doesn\'t believe Mary. He thinks she\'s lying.
Tom doesn\'t deserve the salary we\'re paying him.
Why are you sorry for something you haven\'t done?
Why doesn\'t the U.S. switch to the metric system?
You don\'t know how to operate a forklift, do you?
You wouldn\'t believe the stuff people throw away.
You\'d better not tell anyone about what happened.
What did you think of the movies we saw yesterday?
What do you do when you and Tom hang out together?
What do you think Tom did with the money he stole?
What do you think is the best way to learn French?
